text: <@U02688JHZ> and <@U0265G76F> - did you see that email from Wibke?
i did, though responding to her other email at moment
will re-read
ah - the 'same as ios'
i mean
we could make wires and screens for everything in android
i think that makes sense, but probably just means we need to be more explicit about what we mean
i don't think we need to honestly
think we need to adapt design (as planned), provide them guidelines, and a few toolkit assets specific to android
along with the roadmap that is indeed same as iOS
so i should probably just plop ios screens into those phones?
personally i think so
with annotations that help describe how android will be different (slightly)
ok

Hey <!channel>, more motion explorations up on basecamp. Options 5 and 6 are using the electric/fractal texture but with different color combinations. 7 uses the new blue color combo with the previous wavy electric lines shrinking inward.
A file was shared
<@U0260V1BX>, do you know if this is an element still being used in the WattUp branding?
I think it could be an easy solve for a unique map pin.
it's not
that i know of
I think that ziba is supposed to be doing some logo exploration around a simplified  that would live in a status bar or something
but i dont know that they are actually working on it...
but there IS a need for a simplified version of the hexagon logo
Hmm... ok. Do you think that's something I should be exploring or should we leave all that to Ziba?
i think we leave it to ziba since we have not been asked to do that (theyre not paying us to do it) <@U02688JHZ> is that correct?

That sounds good to me, I guess I'm wondering if there are any other parts to this branding system that I can use to influence some of this stuff I'm doing, the whole thing seems pretty undecided to me at this point.
I get the sense that there are no other parts of the branding system, but i may be wrong
<http://www.katu.com/news/local/Reward-offered-in-deadly-shooting-of-SE-Portland-man-277800112.html>

attachments.title: Reward offered in deadly shooting of SE Portland man
attachments.text: Portland police said they believe Michael William Olson was killed during a robbery.
attachments.fallback: KATU.com: Reward offered in deadly shooting of SE Portland man

text: happened in woodstock
and yes, it is undecided. but i think we just need to work with what we have at this point...

Well what I'm saying is I have a bunch of stuff that evidently isn't being used anymore, trying to parse through and figure out what is/isn't usable. I'm just not sure if I should try creating a new element or wait for them to make something and use a placeholder for this map pin.
i think the only thing we should be going off of is the logo and that styleguide PDF

i hear you about the map pin thing though. I'd say if you want to try and create a simplified version of it for that, feel free to do so— design how you think it should look instead of waiting on ziba...
<@U02688JHZ> thoughts?
sorry
the logo stuff has been a little hot-potato
I'd lost track of it, but did think that the version of the logo/mark/whatever to be included in a status bar was on us
thinking the app/digital stuff is a little out of ziba's range
but we haven't specifically been asked to do it
i agree that we are the best ones for the job... for some reason i thought it was on their plate though
I did too
like I said, I lost track of it, so I could be misremembering

Well I can say that their current elements are NOT super awesome for a reduced icon... the hexagon thing quickly looks like a hex bolt when reduced to simple shapes and their wordmark isn't exactly strong enough to break up for a solo W or anything... should I be focusing more effort on a new icon then?
i think you should explore something that will be readable in the status bar... i wouldnt necessarily say that we need to use the w from their logo
i think that W that was in In's file was the start of something interesting that just got cast aside
and if there is a way to make the hex thing work that would be cool too
i dont think that we need to create a 3rd "thing" though... that's neither a hex or some play on their logo (W or whateever)
because that would be completely detached from everything else...
Yeah I'll see what I can do with it, I'm trying to say though that what we have doesn't lend itself well to this type of reduction. Time to roll up the sleeves.
yeah whatever it is will have to be drawn from scratch
for sure
sorry, i misunderstood you
Do you think they would be pissed if I redrew the wordmark? (only joking, half joking)
i dont think they would
in fact i remember that coming up at some point on a call - that energous is not attached to that wordmark
Because, <@U0260V1BX>, it's really really poorly drawn, it hurts me to look at it up close.
that being said, i dont think it's super high priority
i would say finishing the sprint 2 screens should take precedent, even if that means using a placeholder map pin
Yeah that's fine, I have one that I'll continue to use, it helps though to know where we're at though as far as what we're responsible for. Thanks!
sure- sorry that was hella confusing
No no, it's all good.
More clarifying than confusing.

thanks you guys! Agree on priority of getting this sprint's screens done. <@U0265G76F> , would love your thoughts when you have a chance (I know your to-do list is loooong right now). If we don't have time to address, we can discuss directly with Ziba and/or Energous on Thursday
also, I'm sad about that Hair of the Dog guy! And glad it wasn't under the bridge right here by work.
just catching up - what do you need thoughts on?
i know motion and latest screens
and models
:wink:
and hair of dog guy?
the link above! trent and melissa and I were talking about it
a busboy at hair of the dog who was murdered, and we thought it was here on water ave/under the bridge
good lord
different than the railroad track body!?
yes
Yeah this was a month ago
don't know who the guy on the tracks was
wow.
but I'm sad about all of it!
ok - back in slack. Looking at link. One sec
ok sorry - which link? I see a link called 'links' that looks great to me
lots of discussion about styleguide stuff — which I agree nobody is going to be angry if we push the system slightly
I think the "link" was in reference to the HotD article
it's a sort of unspoken hot potato
oh - yes - that's awful!
Can we talk about the hot potato? Or do we want to avoid that with Ziba?
as for branding - i think we should use the styleguide as our compass, but may need to create custom stuff along the way
the hot potato in this case was the WattUp wordmark
Think it came with energous, and Ziba repurposed it within somewhat of a system
but then circled back and said — nobody's in LOVE with the wordmark
the hot potato trent is referring to is the simplified logo that would live in the status bar...
ah
sorry - slack is hard to catch up on
no problem
so i guess as a blanket statement, I'd say make what we need to make
if something is just not working within this loosely defined system, let's push it a bit
but, as with above, let's crank thru screens first
The hot potato is everything not talked about I guess. There seems to be a lot of confusion and I feel it would be good at some point to get some idea of who has what between us and Ziba
and figure out opportunities like that — small improvements — that we could introduce when their dev team isn't scrambling just to create a functional demo that looks pretty decent
And screens are def top priority!
cool
well - i think the thing about all of this, unless I'm mistaken, aside from ID, Ziba isn't doing any more concepting around brand/style
am i right on that <@U02688JHZ> ?
which is to say - i don't know that there's a hot anything. Especially in creating a simplified logo for our status bar. I know they're not doing that
We can confirm. I think they're firmly focused on ID

So - to that end, I believe what style exists is what exists. Anything else we need/want to do along the way is on us. Ideally it'll play in harmony with what's already been created, though I'm certain there's cases (e.g. small, reduced size logos) that may need some pushing forward.
Or map pins
cases where nobody's thought through the overarching system specifics
Got it. That helps a lot actually.
i also think there's going to likely be some evolution that happens in both photography and copy work that we'll be in charge of.

and if nothing else, i think it'd be great (time, budget, details allowing) to use some of that extra time between our deliverables and the end of our engagement to just peek back and figure out areas of polish that we think would help them. Especially after we have a more cohesive set of tools at our disposal — Full app designs, most  web designs, photos, copy, ID from ziba.
that's the unfortunate balance of design within this sort of sprint-heavy structure — Design is never 'done', sprints are all about getting stuff done.
So the brand is taking shape as we go.
and I'm running into this too with photo stuff — how to tell them what we're going to shoot in words and moodboards, not to mention how we might use it, before any of it is shot
anyway - that's a bunch of words from a guy who isn't there. Let me know if any of that's helpful or if any of the above makes sense.
thanks <@U02688JHZ> for that list BTW
That definitely makes sense. It clears up some confusion around my "who has what?" questions.
My answer, always, is — You've got it Trent!
<http://rs1145.pbsrc.com/albums/o503/rosettemaudine/19.gif~c200>
Oh I know I got it, now I know I can take it from them too.
